mods.abstract: Ranaway FROM the subscriber, living near Fillmore, Bossier parish, a negro boy named BOTTS, but will probably call himself Hartwell. He is low and stoutly built, weighing about 140 pounds; is 28 years old; parrot-toed in walking; has an evident dislocation of the left-wrist; very bad teeth and looks one in the face when speaking. He may be in company with a white man, and may possibly aim for Texas. A suitable reward will be paid for the delivery of said boy to me, or if lodged in jail so that I can get him again. Or I will pay a reward of one hundred dollars for the apprehension and conviction of any one who may have enticed him from Fillmore. J. J. STEWART. Bossier parish, La. February 7, 1855.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
